oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Umbilical cord care: effects on navel involution, calf health and growth
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wieland, M.
Mann, S.
Guard, C.
Nydam, D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: umbilical disease
newborn
disorder
naval infection
navel dips
ultrasound
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Despite the importance of umbilical disease as a risk factor for newborn calf morbidity, research data on umbilical cord care are lacking. Moreover, no practical technique for objective detection of umbilical disorders in calves under field conditions has been described. The primary objective of this study was to investigate the influence of umbilical cord care on navel infection. A secondary objective of this study was to describe umbilical involution in calves receiving different navel dips using ultrasonography. To improve applicability for veterinary practitioners and researchers alike, an ultrasound device was chosen that would commonly be used in the field.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2015; 228
